subtitleNullable: Better labels for the FER emotion recognition dataset by Microsoft
descriptionNullable:
### Context
FER2013 is a very interesting and useful dataset. However the labels of many images are not exactly right. Fer2013Plus was an effort by Microsoft to correct that. 

### What's the difference from FER2013?
The labels have been replaced with the maximum prediction of 15 other people who gave their version of them. Hence it has much more accurate labels.

### Acknowledgement
I do not own the data and have not conducted either experiment. I just find FER to be a very overused dataset and having better labels is nice. Microsoft provided a utility to make this happen with crowdsourced labels but it is a little hard to get to work and many people might just give up. So I rewrote the porting code and did the processing myself in the hopes it would help others.

### A note
If anyone who owns this data has an issue with it, feel free to let me know and I will take it down.

### Disclaimer
I am in no way affiliated with Microsoft or the team that made FER or the new labels. This dataset is not mine and I claim no credit for it in any way except making it a little easier for the masses to find.

### References
https://www.kaggle.com/msambare/fer2013
https://github.com/microsoft/FERPlus

@inproceedings{BarsoumICMI2016,
    title={Training Deep Networks for Facial Expression Recognition with Crowd-Sourced Label Distribution},
    author={Barsoum, Emad and Zhang, Cha and Canton Ferrer, Cristian and Zhang, Zhengyou},
    booktitle={ACM International Conference on Multimodal Interaction (ICMI)},
    year={2016}
title: Fer2013Plus
